## Uploading the file "trgn599.clinical.tsv":
```{R}
clinical_data <- read.table("trgn599.clinical.tsv", header = TRUE, sep = "\t")
```


#Creating a Data frame by typing the data
```{R}
a = c(3, 7, 9) 
b = c("CG", "AT", "GC") 
c = c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE) 
df = data.frame(a, b, c)       # df is a data frame
df
```

#Creating a Data frame by selecting data from a table
```{R}
df_clinical_data = data.frame(clinical_data$UID, clinical_data$weight, clinical_data$gender)
df_clinical_data[1:5,1:3]
```

# Creating a Box Plot using biology related public R datasets
```{R}
# Boxplot of tooth growth (dataset) against two factors
boxplot(len~supp*dose, data=ToothGrowth, notch=TRUE, 
  col=(c("lightblue","blue")),
  main="TRGN 599 - Boxplot - Tooth Growth", xlab="Suppliment and Dose")
```

# Creating a Box Plot using biology related public R datasets
```{R}
# Violin Plots
#install.packages("sm") - type "no" when asking for compilation
#install.packages("vioplot")
library("vioplot")
a1 <- ToothGrowth$len[ToothGrowth$supp=="VC"]
a2 <- ToothGrowth$len[ToothGrowth$supp=="OJ"]
vioplot(a1, a2, names=c("VC", "OJ"), 
   col="green")
title("TRGN 599 - Violin Plots - Tooth Growth")
```

# Creating a Histogram using biology related public R datasets
```{R}
colesterol_Dataset <- read.table("col.txt", header = TRUE)
colesterol_Dataset[1:2,1:5]
hist(colesterol_Dataset$AGE)
hist(colesterol_Dataset$HEIGHT)
hist(colesterol_Dataset$WEIGHT)
```

# Creating a Density Plot using biology related public R datasets
```{R}
d1 <- density(colesterol_Dataset$AGE)
plot(d1, main="TRGN 599: Kernel Density of AGE-Colesterol Dataset")
polygon(d1, col="red", border="blue")

d1 <- density(colesterol_Dataset$HEIGHT)
plot(d1, main="TRGN 599: Kernel Density of HEIGHT-Colesterol Dataset")
polygon(d1, col="blue", border="red")

d1 <- density(colesterol_Dataset$WEIGHT)
plot(d1, main="TRGN 599: Kernel Density of WEIGHT-Colesterol Dataset")
polygon(d1, col="yellow", border="green")
```

# Create a new dataset without missing data
```{R}
# create new clinical dataset without NA data
new_clinical_data <- na.omit(clinical_data)
```

# Creating Bar plots
```{R}
# Simple Bar Plot 
counts <- table(new_clinical_data$race)
barplot(counts, main="TRGN 599: Race Distribution", 
   xlab="Race")

# Simple Bar Plot 
counts <- table(new_clinical_data$tumor_stage)
barplot(counts, main="TRGN 599: Tumor Stage Distribution", 
   xlab="Tumor Stage")
```

# Creating grouped Bar Plot
```{R}
# Simple Bar Plot 
counts <- table(new_clinical_data$race, new_clinical_data$tumor_stage)
barplot(counts, main="TRGN 599: Patient Distribution by Tumor stage and Race", 
   xlab="Tumor stage", col=c("black", "blue", "red", "yellow"),
  legend = rownames(counts), beside=TRUE)
```

# Creating a Simple Pie Chart
```{R}
#
slices <- table(new_clinical_data$gender)
lbls <- c("Female", "Male")
pie(slices, labels = lbls, main="TRGN 599: Pie Chart of Gender")


# 3D Exploded Pie Chart
# install.packages("plotrix")
library(plotrix)
slices <- table(new_clinical_data$gender)
lbls <- c("Female", "Male")
pie3D(slices,labels=lbls,explode=0.1,
   main="TRGN 599: 3D Pie Chart of Gender")
```
